title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the spending multiplier: M=∆GDP/∆G) = (400/100) = 4
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the spending multiplier: M=∆GDP/∆G) = (400/100) = 4

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the spending multiplier: M=∆GDP/∆G) = (400/100) = 4

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that a larger decrease in income taxes will be needed because part of the increase in disposable income will be saved.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that a larger decrease in income taxes will be needed because part of the increase in disposable income will be saved.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that a larger decrease in income taxes will be needed because part of the increase in disposable income will be saved.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the spending multiplier will increase.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the spending multiplier will increase.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the spending multiplier will increase.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the change in real gross domestic product would be smaller.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the change in real gross domestic product would be smaller.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the change in real gross domestic product would be smaller.

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that real GDP remains unchanged.

  • One point is earned for explaining that input prices adjust to the long-run equilibrium immediately.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that real GDP remains unchanged.

  • One point is earned for explaining that input prices adjust to the long-run equilibrium immediately.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for explaining that input prices adjust to the long-run equilibrium immediately.

Earns 2 of 2 points.
